item.title: The Internet Arcade
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: The Internet Arcade, from the Internet Archive: The Internet Arcade is a web-based library of arcade (coin-operated) video games from the 1970s through to the 1990s, emulated in JSMAME, part of the JSMESS software package. Containing hundreds of games ranging through many different genres and styles, the Arcade provides research, comparison, and entertainment in the […]
item.content:encoded:
The Internet Arcade, from the Internet Archive:

The Internet Arcade is a web-based library of arcade (coin-operated) video games from the 1970s through to the 1990s, emulated in JSMAME, part of the JSMESS software package. Containing hundreds of games ranging through many different genres and styles, the Arcade provides research, comparison, and entertainment in the realm of the Video Game Arcade.

They have a number of classic games in there ( Defender! ) along with lots of titles I’ve never seen before.

item.title: Breakouts
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Breakouts: … a gathering of various implementations of the classic game Breakout in numerous different engines. With source code for each version of Breakout.
item.content:encoded:
Breakouts:

… a gathering of various implementations of the classic game Breakout in numerous different engines.

With source code for each version of Breakout.

item.title: Mari0
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Have you ever wondered what a Super Mario Brothers plus Portal game might look like? Well, the folks at stabyourself.net did and they came up with Mari0. They have Windows, Linux, and OS X versions of the game you can download, as well as the source code. I played the OS X version for a […]
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever wondered what a Super Mario Brothers plus Portal game might look like? Well, the folks at stabyourself.net did and they came up with Mari0.



They have Windows, Linux, and OS X versions of the game you can download, as well as the source code. I played the OS X version for a few minutes and was impressed with how well they merged these two games together.

item.title: Drone Racer
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: http://racer.sputnic.tv/ put together what amounts to an unmanned race car drone. They modeled it after old school race car video games. MythBusters needs find a reason to build a full scale version of this ðŸ™‚ The video is rough, but gives you a good idea of how well this works.
item.content:encoded:
http://racer.sputnic.tv/ put together what amounts to an unmanned race car drone. They modeled it after old school race car video games. MythBusters needs find a reason to build a full scale version of this

The video is rough, but gives you a good idea of how well this works.
